an10.23:1.1: “Mendicants, there are things that should be given up by the body, not by speech.
an10.23:1.2: There are things that should be given up by speech, not by the body.
an10.23:1.3: There are things that should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom.
an10.23:2.1: And what are the things that should be given up by the body, not by speech?
an10.23:2.2: It’s when a mendicant has committed a certain unskillful offense by way of body.
an10.23:2.3: After examination, sensible spiritual companions say this to them:
an10.23:2.4: ‘Venerable, you’ve committed a certain unskillful offense by way of body.
an10.23:2.5: Please give up that bad bodily conduct and develop good bodily conduct.’
an10.23:2.6: When spoken to by their sensible spiritual companions they give up that bad bodily conduct and develop good bodily conduct.
an10.23:2.7: These are the things that should be given up by the body, not by speech.
an10.23:3.1: And what are the things that should be given up by speech, not by the body?
an10.23:3.2: It’s when a mendicant has committed a certain unskillful offense by way of speech.
an10.23:3.3: After examination, sensible spiritual companions say this to them:
an10.23:3.4: ‘Venerable, you’ve committed a certain unskillful offense by way of speech.
an10.23:3.5: Please give up that bad verbal conduct and develop good verbal conduct.’
an10.23:3.6: When spoken to by their sensible spiritual companions they give up that bad verbal conduct and develop good verbal conduct.
an10.23:3.7: These are the things that should be given up by speech, not by the body.
an10.23:4.1: And what are the things that should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom?
an10.23:4.9: and stinginess are things that should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom.
an10.23:5.1: Nasty jealousy should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom.
an10.23:5.3: It’s when a householder or their child is prospering in money, grain, silver, or gold.
an10.23:5.4: And a bondservant or dependent thinks:
an10.23:5.5: ‘Oh, may that householder or their child not prosper in money, grain, silver, or gold!’
an10.23:5.6: Or an ascetic or brahmin receives robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
an10.23:5.7: And some other ascetic or brahmin thinks:
an10.23:5.8: ‘Oh, may that ascetic or brahmin not receive robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.’
an10.23:6.1: Corrupt wishes should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom.
an10.23:6.3: It’s when a faithless person wishes to be known as faithful.
an10.23:6.4: An unethical person wishes to be known as ethical.
an10.23:6.5: An unlearned person wishes to be known as learned.
an10.23:6.6: A lover of company wishes to be known as secluded.
an10.23:6.7: A lazy person wishes to be known as energetic.
an10.23:6.8: An unmindful person wishes to be known as mindful.
an10.23:6.9: A person without immersion wishes to be known as having immersion.
an10.23:6.10: A witless person wishes to be known as wise.
an10.23:6.11: Someone who has not ended the defilements wishes to be known as having ended the defilements.
an10.23:6.13: Corrupt wishes should be given up neither by the body, nor by speech, but by seeing again and again with wisdom.
an10.23:7.1: Suppose that greed masters that mendicant and keeps going.
an10.23:7.10: or corrupt wishes master them and keep going.
an10.23:7.12: ‘This venerable does not have the understanding that would eliminate greed, so greed masters them and keeps going.
an10.23:7.13: They don’t have the understanding that would eliminate hate …
an10.23:7.21: or corrupt wishes, so corrupt wishes master them and keep going.’
an10.23:8.1: Suppose that greed does not master that mendicant and keep going.
an10.23:8.10: or corrupt wishes don’t master that mendicant and keep going.
an10.23:8.12: ‘This venerable has the understanding that eliminates greed, so greed doesn’t master them and keep going.
an10.23:8.13: They have the understanding that eliminates hate …
an10.23:8.21: and corrupt wishes, so corrupt wishes don’t master them and keep going.’”
